result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Gregory Moser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to sign up for Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Defendant to complete an MRT. 
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court may consider an early release.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***

-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
-Attorneys to get the number of days credti by the end of the week.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Court reviews file. ADA Minser updates the court and recites agreement. Atty Skatrud makes statement. Court questions. Defendant makes statement. Court Orders. 
On 16CF61 - 6 years prison. 2 yrs i/c, 4 yrs e/s- 
- Court Costs $268.00
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250.00; Apply Bond
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested

17CF354 -

Sentencing hearing on June 19, 2018 at 02:15 pm.

CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Benoy ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Arne Richard Skatrud   DF:  Andrew Gregory Moser appeared from jail.  INCLUDES:  STC for 16CF61 & PLEA on 17CF354.  Atty Skatrud states that 17CF354 is resolved.  Plea will be taken on 17CF354. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 w/out repeater in 17CF354. ADA Minser recites agreement.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Amended Ct 1 (w/out repeater) in 17CF354. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & 3 in 17CF354. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2018 at 02:15 pm.
